bug.author: cbertolasio
bug.description:
Maybe this document should include what version of the model is downloaded when multiple versions exists? I think I figured out through trial and error that if I omit the version in the ctor, then the latest version is what is downloaded - but why not talk about the default behavior in this document? <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h4>Document Details</denchmark-h>
⚠ Do not edit this section. It is required for docs.microsoft.com ➟ GitHub issue linking.
ID: 08d33267-fb2b-bc8a-1b61-50122b944dd1 Version Independent ID: 17c92047-89c8-0881-6d9f-235f50a2d5af Content: azureml.core.model.Model class - Azure Machine Learning Python Content Source: AzureML/docs-ref-autogen/azureml-core/azureml.core.model.Model.yml Service: machine-learning Sub-service: core GitHub Login: @j-martens Microsoft Alias: jmartens

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/cbertolasio>@cbertolasio</denchmark-link>
Thanks for the feedback! I have assigned the issue to the content author to investigate further and update the document as appropriate.
We updated the docs to clarify. Changes will appear in next SDK release in approx two weeks.
